Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat

m + S n = S n + m

Qed.```

Example 2:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), inv_hmap (L m zero x y) -> let x_1 := cA_1 m one x in let x0 := cA m zero x in expf m x_1 y <-> ~ expf (L m zero x y) y x0

Premises:
dart = nat : Set
cA = fix cA (m : fmap) (k : dim) (z : dart) {struct m} : dart := match m with | V => nil | I m0 x _ _ => if eq_dart_dec x z then z else cA m0 k z | L m0 k0 x y => if eq_dim_dec k0 k then if eq_dart_dec x z then y else if eq_dart_dec (cA_1 m0 k y) z then cA m0 k x else cA m0 k z else cA m0 k z end with cA_1 (m : fmap) (k : dim) (z : dart) {struct m} : dart := match m with | V => nil | I m0 x _ _ => if eq_dart_dec x z then z else cA_1 m0 k
expf = fun (m : fmap) (x y : dart) => inv_hmap m /\ MF.expo m x y : fmap -> dart -> dart -> Prop
Inductive fmap : Set := V : fmap | I : fmap -> dart -> tag -> point -> fmap | L : fmap -> dim -> dart -> dart -> fmap
inv_hmap = fix inv_hmap (m : fmap) : Prop := match m with | V => True | I m0 x _ _ => inv_hmap m0 /\ prec_I m0 x | L m0 k0 x y => inv_hmap m0 /\ prec_L m0 k0 x y end : fmap -> Prop
cA_1 = fix cA (m : fmap) (k : dim) (z : dart) {struct m} : dart := match m with | V => nil | I m0 x _ _ => if eq_dart_dec x z then z else cA m0 k z | L m0 k0 x y => if eq_dim_dec k0 k then if eq_dart_dec x z then y else if eq_dart_dec (cA_1 m0 k y) z then cA m0 k x else cA m0 k z else cA m0 k z end with cA_1 (m : fmap) (k : dim) (z : dart) {struct m} : dart := match m with | V => nil | I m0 x _ _ => if eq_dart_dec x z then z else cA_1 m
Inductive dim : Set := zero : dim | one : dim

expf_L0_CN_2 : forall (m : fmap) (x y z : dart) (i : nat), inv_hmap (L m zero x y) -> exd m z -> let x0 := cA m zero x in let x_1 := cA_1 m one x in let y_0 := cA_1 m zero y in let y_0_1 := cA_1 m one y_0 in let t := Iter (cF (L m zero x y)) i z in ~ expf m x_1 y -> expf m z t \/ expf m z y /\ expf m t x0 \/ expf m t y /\ expf m z x0

expf_L0_CN : forall (m : fmap) (x y z t : dart), inv_hmap (L m zero x y) -> exd m z -> expf (L m zero x y) z t -> let x0 := cA m zero x in let x_1 := cA_1 m one x in let y_0 := cA_1 m zero y in let y_0_1 := cA_1 m one y_0 in if expf_dec m x_1 y then betweenf m x_1 z y /\ betweenf m x_1 t y \/ betweenf m y_0_1 z x0 /\ betweenf m y_0_1 t x0 \/ ~ expf m x_1 z /\ expf m z t else expf m z t \/ expf m z y /\ expf m t x0 \/ expf m t y /\ expf m z x0

cF_L0_2 : forall (m : fmap) (x y z : dart), inv_hmap (L m zero x y) -> let y_0_1 := cF m y in let x0 := cA m zero x in betweenf m y_0_1 z x0 -> cF (L m zero x y) z = (if eq_dart_dec x0 z then y_0_1 else cF m z)

planarity_criterion_1 : forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> prec_L m one x y -> planar m -> planar (L m one x y) < -> ~ eqc m x y \/ expf m x (cA m zero y)
planarity_criterion_0 : forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> prec_L m zero x y -> planar m -> planar (L m zero x y) < -> ~ eqc m x y \/ expf m (cA_1 m one x) y

planarity_crit_0 : forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> prec_L m zero x y -> planar (L m zero x y) < -> planar m /\ (~ eqc m x y \/ expf m (cA_1 m one x) y)

```coq
Proof.
intros m x y H.
unfold not; intros N.
rewrite <- expf_L0_CN_1 with (i:=0) by eauto.
destruct (expf_dec m (cA_1 m one x) y) as [E|NE].
{ left.
  apply expf_L0_CS with (t:=y) by eauto.
}
{ right.
  apply expf_L0_CS with (t:=y) by eauto.
}
Qed.
